subject: Re: [junit] Problems with assertEquals...
msgSnippet: ... This is what I use in my subclass of TestCase: /** * Asserts that two Dates are equal concerning a delta in milliseconds. */ public static void
messageBody:
> I can't seem to figure out why this is failing without diving into the
> source code for junit or the JDK. I'm using JDK 131_08 and trying to
> call assertEquals to compare two java.util.Date objects. The values are
> the same but assertEquals thinks they are different. Any ideas? I know
> it's calling the equals method so it should pass unless I'm missing
> something.

This is what I use in my subclass of TestCase:

/**
* Asserts that two Dates are equal concerning a delta in
milliseconds.
*/
public static void assertEquals(Date expectedDate, Date actualDate,
long deltaMilliseconds) {
assertEquals(null, expectedDate, actualDate, deltaMilliseconds);
}

/**
* Asserts that two Dates are equal concerning a delta in
milliseconds. If they are not,
* an <code>AssertionFailedError</code> is thrown with the given
<code>message</code>.
*/
public static void assertEquals(String message, Date expectedDate,
Date actualDate, long deltaMilliseconds) {
if (!(Math.abs(expectedDate.getTime() - actualDate.getTime())
<= deltaMilliseconds))
_failNotEquals(message, expectedDate, actualDate);
}


Christian
